page.title: 06UNUSUAL SHERWOOD
page.content: One night at the{Visitor's Centre} a ranger was awoken by the police with a story that a courting couple in the car park had seen a{Bear}climbing a tree.The police and ranger found no bear but there are still claw marks at the top of the tree!! The rarest bird is a{Red-backed {Shrike}and the rarest plant is a{ {Common Spotted Orchid}which may have been moved in with concrete rubble. The Visitor's Centre does not belong to Notts.County Council but is on a 66 year lease from{Thoresby {Estates.Budby Forest}is on lease to the{Army. { }The{Rangers}plant{2,000}trees a year and remove 200 because of disease or danger to{tourists.}The Centre buildings are a haven for wildlife because of the pickings left by the tourists.
